Description: Fragment, mended from three sherds, of rim and floor of North Ionian black-figured pottery plate. Flaring sofa rim with ridge at junction with floor; flat base with two shallow grooves at outside. Cream slip. Outside and underside reserved. On rim, between bands, guilloche with added spikes; at outside of floor, much worn maeander band; to the inside a band perhaps with added colour, and animal frieze preserving part of lion to left.
Curator's comments: Almost certainly from same plate as 1965,0930.464. Akin to Boston, MFA, 88.825.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.993)
